question.text: Find out the incorrect statement from the following.

options.text: Dark reaction depends on the product formed by light reaction.
In the stroma, enzymatic reactions incorporate CO<sub>2</sub> into the plant leading to the synthesis of sugar.
Purple and green sulphur bacteria use H<sub>2</sub>S as hydrogen donor.
There is no division of labour in chloroplast, dark and light reaction occurs in same compartment.

solution.text: Photosynthesis consists of two steps, light reaction and dark reaction. Light reaction occurs in grana of chloroplast which are made up of bundles of grana. Dark reaction occurs in stroma of chloroplast. The product of light reaction are used in dark reaction to fix CO<sub>2</sub> to form glucose.
